title: Britain's most expensive bed and breakfast Lockgate Dairy charges £1,425 per night
text:
47 shares 26
View
comments
This is Britain's most expensive bed & breakfast - charging a staggering £1,425 per night.
Anyone wanting a double room at Lockgate Dairy on September 11 will have to pay the same price as deluxe suite at The Ritz.
The staggering price has been bumped up because of the Goodwood Revival event, which takes place that weekend near the B&B in Sussex.
Anyone wanting a double room at Lockgate Dairy on September 11 will have to pay the same price as deluxe suite at The Ritz
Visitors to Lockgate Dairy get a modern room within a barn conversion which features a fully vaulted ceiling and oak beams, en-suite shower room and underfloor heating, according to the website
Incredibly, the price has been reduced by five per cent from £1,500 per night.
It is around ten times the average price at Lockgate Dairy, which is owned by husband and wife Martin and Helen Lockwood.

The ugly truth about those amazing Instagram shots:... 47 shares Martin defended the price and - despite not having secured a booking yet - says he has had no problem filling the room in previous years.
He said: 'We provide a fantastic service. The rooms are lovely, the gardens are beautiful and it is a great location.
'Our prices are typically around £100 to £160 per night, but when there are events on at Goodwood we achieve good premiums.
'Before we sold a room at this level a gentleman phoned up and said there was mistake on the website, but when I said there wasn't he just put the phone down.
'The prices reflect season, month of year, day of week, event fixtures, closeness to day of stay and the good old fashioned British weather.
'We make money in the summer and we lose money in the winter. It is yield management.'
For £1,460, you can get an 860 sq/ft suite with its own drawing room and two bathrooms at The Ritz (pictured)
Visitors to Lockgate Dairy get a modern room within a barn conversion which features a fully vaulted ceiling and oak beams, en-suite shower room and underfloor heating, according to the website.
There is a TV with Freeview, 'strong and reliable' Wi-Fi and tea and coffee making facilities.
If customers wanted to stay at Lockgate Dairy this Friday, it would cost them just £171 for the same room.
The bumper increase in room price ties in with the Goodwood Revival, a weekend of historic racing and motoring events which takes place nearby.
Multi-millionaires from around the world will be in West Sussex for the event - letting professional racing drivers thrash their classic Ferraris and Aston Martins round the Goodwood race track.
With 150,000 people attending, their is a massive shortage of accommodation in the area.
But the prices Lockgate Dairy are staggering - even compared to the Ritz.
An executive room with breakfast on September 11 at London's most famous hotel costs £548.
For £1,460, you can get an 860 sq/ft suite with its own drawing room and two bathrooms.
Martin added: 'Some of our customers have said the breakfast is better than at the Ritz.'
